messages.content:
What do you see in this data? This is a list of tasks, each task has a set of skills required to do it, find and cluster all the skills you can from this list and make a table. You can also extract any other information and make a third column: 
How can you use GPT in your job based on what you’ve learned?
Answers: 
HR: Create the JDs from scratch
Enhance the onboarding process - maybe also turn it into a video
Pitch decks for Bloom?
Analyzing performance reviews
Clarify goals and turn them into specific st
Help think about solutions and simplifications, Helping users have better insights with the assessments they have
Understand their strengths and weaknesses
Proofreading
Structured thinking 
Content writing
Validating ideas
Write books summaries and actions
Write actions for library’s items
Write processes and strategies
Avery -Grant writing: using GPT to check my writing for central concepts, alignment with principles, adherence to best practices
Asking detailed questions about concepts. For example, I asked GPT all about neoliberalism because it’s a concept I know I should know and was embarrassed to ask about. Now I understand it :D
Library: developing descriptions and summaries for content.
Developing drafts on ideas for content for various media, better categorizing data and reports and helping in identifying patterns when it comes to analytics, assisting in the provision of ideas for keywords for SEO
Ideation for program design
Better insights from assessments for curriculum design
Data analysis
Better activities for teams that are more aligned with their entire situation 
Aligning mentors and teams better
Finding academic references for data analysis
Helping writers

Table of Skills:

| Skill               | Tasks                                      |
|---------------------|--------------------------------------------|
| Writing             | HR, Pitch decks for Bloom, Content writing |
| Communication       | HR, Enhancing onboarding process           |
| Analyzing           | Analyzing performance reviews, Data analysis|
| Strategic Thinking  | Clarifying goals, Ideation for program design, Developing drafts on ideas for content, Better activities for teams |
| Editing             | Proofreading                               |
| Summarizing         | Write book summaries and actions, Developing descriptions and summaries for content |
| Research            | Avery - Grant writing, Finding academic references for data analysis, Helping writers |
| Ideation            | Ideation for program design, Validating ideas, Better insights from assessments for curriculum design |
| Collaboration       | Aligning mentors and teams better          |
| SEO                 | Assisting in the provision of ideas for keywords for SEO |

From the provided list of tasks, it is evident that the skills required are diverse and range from communication, analytical, strategic thinking, editing, summarizing, research, ideation, collaboration, and search engine optimization. The tasks also involve creating JDs, enhancing the onboarding process, analyzing performance reviews, clarifying goals, validating ideas, proofreading, structured thinking, developing content drafts, better categorizing data, and reports, identifying patterns, designing curriculum, aligning mentors and teams better, finding academic references, and helping writers.

Based on what has been learned, GPT can be used to aid in a variety of tasks, such as generating job descriptions, developing onboarding videos, creating pitch decks, analyzing performance reviews, summarizing content, validating ideas, generating better SEO keywords, ideating for program design, designing better curriculum, and finding academic references for data analysis. Additionally, GPT can assist in researching, writing, and proofreading, thereby enhancing the efficiency and quality of work.
